content:
Meeting 2021-05-18T17:00:00+02:00

Agenda:

  • Triage
  • Metadata Collector
  • Documentation

T-13min (Sorry forgot to post this earlier)
Meeting time :wave:
Triage should be quick this week. I still have to do a beta backport from a ICE fix. Otherwise, I don't know of anything @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

Second point is the Metadata collector, that @xFrednet worked on recently: rust-clippy#7172 It is now integrated in Clippy and we plan to switch over to that in the next few weeks. This will get rid of our python scripts and will generate the documentation through static analysis :crab:
This is mostly an announcement and a thanks you for @xFrednet , if you have any concerns about that, let us know @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

And last thing from me: We plan to change the documentation style of our lints to use headers. We have a thread about this here on Zulip, I just wanted to also raise awareness about this in the meeting.

Any concerns about that? @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
That's it from me. @Manish Goregaokar go ahead with the Jane news.

Alright. Jane (yaahc) has been pretty busy these days and feeling a bit overwhelmed, she was taking a break from clippy work for a while but even having team GitHub pings in her inbox were becoming overwhelming, so she decided to step down from the team. She may join again in the future if she wants to, but right now she's trying to focus her efforts in a couple high priority areas in the project.
In general if you're on the team and feeling overwhelmed, it's totally okay to step down and come back later (or remove yourself from the reviewer rotation, but sometimes a clean break is better)
Understandable. She's always welcome to come back, as everyone! Thanks for the heads-up.
I think that should be it for today's quick meeting @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Alright, thanks for attending! :wave:

Manish Goregaokar said:

In general if you're on the team and feeling overwhelmed, it's totally okay to step down and come back later (or remove yourself from the reviewer rotation, but sometimes a clean break is better)

Just want to add that I've been MIA the past weeks for similar reasons. Ideally I would like to commit to a fixed amount of time per week, but it's tough to find a system that plays nicely with $work and $outside-hobby :neutral:
